com.bigdata.btree.proc

Class AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.btree.proc.AbstractIndexProcedure<T>
      • com.bigdata.btree.proc.AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IIndexProcedure<T>, IKeyArrayIndexProcedure<T>, IReadOnly, Externalizable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchContains, BatchInsert, BatchLookup, BatchPutIfAbsent, BatchRemove, BlobsWriteProc, Id2TermWriteProc, JustIndexWriteProc, SPOIndexWriteProc, Term2IdWriteProc, TextIndexWriteProc

    public abstract class AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure<T>
extends AbstractIndexProcedure<T>
implements IKeyArrayIndexProcedure<T>, Externalizable
    Abstract base class supports compact serialization and compression for remote IKeyArrayIndexProcedure execution (procedures may be executed on a local index, but they are only (de-)serialized when executed on a remote index).
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    (Schedule more IOs when loading data), Serialized Form

      Knows how to aggregate AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure.ResultBitBuffer objects.
      static class  AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure.ResultBuffer
      A class useful for sending some kinds of data back from a remote procedure call (those readily expressed as a byte[][]).
      static class  AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure.ResultBufferHandler
      Knows how to aggregate AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure.ResultBuffer objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure

        protected AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure()
        De-serialization constructor.

      • AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure

        protected AbstractKeyArrayIndexProcedure(IRabaCoder keysCoder,
                              IRabaCoder valsCoder,
                              int fromIndex,
                              int toIndex,
                              byte[][] keys,
                              byte[][] vals)
        Parameters:
        keysCoder - The object used to serialize the keys.
        valsCoder - The object used to serialize the vals (optional IFF vals is null).
        fromIndex - The index of the first key in keys to be processed (inclusive).
        toIndex - The index of the last key in keys to be processed.
        keys - The keys (unsigned variable length byte[]s) MUST be in sorted order (the logic to split procedures across partitioned indices depends on this, plus ordered reads and writes on indices are MUCH more efficient).
        vals - The values (optional, must be co-indexed with keys when non-null).

      • newAggregator

        protected abstract IResultHandler<T,T> newAggregator()
        Return an IResultHandler that will be used to combine the results if the index procedure is parallelized against a local index (including a scale-out shard). If a null is returned, then the index procedure WILL NOT be parallelized against the local index. To parallelize index procedures that do not return anything against a local index, just use NopAggregator. A non-null value will permit both index local parallelization of the index procedure and (in scale-out) parallelization of the index procedure across the shards as well. In order to be parallelized, the index procedure must also be marked as IParallelizableIndexProcedure.
        Returns:
        The IResultHandler -or- null
        See Also:
        NopAggregator, IParallelizableIndexProcedure, (Schedule more IOs when loading data)

      • apply

        public final T apply(IIndex ndx)
        Applies the logic of the procedure.

        Note: For invocations where the IRaba.size() of the keys is large, this class breaks down the keys into a multiple key ranges to parallelize the work. If the procedure is read-only, then we can trivially parallelize the operation. When the procedure is read-write, a prefetch pattern is used to ensure that the index pages are in cache and then work is handed off to a single thread that does the actual work while obeying the single-threaded for writer constraint on the index.

        Specified by:
        apply in interface IIndexProcedure<T>
        Parameters:
        ndx - The index.
        Returns:
        The result, which is entirely defined by the procedure implementation and which MAY be null. In general, this MUST be Serializable since it may have to pass across a network interface.
        See Also:
        (Schedule more IOs when loading data)

      • writeMetadata

        protected void writeMetadata(ObjectOutput out)
                      throws IOException
        Writes metadata (not the keys or values, but just other metadata used by the procedure).

        The default implementation writes out the getKeysCoder() and the getValuesCoder().

        Parameters:
        out -
        Throws:
        IOException
